project_name: Take Your Time - Improving Optimization Performance Through Greater Investment in ACQF Optimizer Runtime
summary:
The project by Taylor Sparks and the team from the University of Utah focuses on enhancing Bayesian optimization runs by employing random seed campaigns. The problem addressed is the variability in performance of Bayesian optimization campaigns when initiated with the same initial data points. These campaigns can either get stuck in local optima or quickly converge to the best solution. The team's approach involves calculating the acquisition function multiple times using different random seeds and selecting the highest performing one at each iteration. This method, termed as random retries optimizer, aims to consistently achieve the best possible campaign performance by avoiding local optima traps. The results demonstrate that this approach significantly improves performance, as evidenced by the red line in their results, which indicates near-optimal performance across different Bayesian campaigns initiated with the same data points.

The project acknowledges the trade-off between additional computation time and improved performance. However, it does not explicitly mention any limitations of the work, such as the potential computational cost or scalability issues across various problem types. The team expresses interest in further exploring the balance between compute time and performance gains, as well as testing the approach on simpler problems. They invite collaboration and engagement through their GitHub page for ongoing development and exploration of these questions.
